Finally, I would like to underline that the #Internet is the property of all people, not of single companies nor of states. This is why we members of parliament very much welcome the multi-stakeholder approach of the #IGF #InternetGovernanceForum #IGf2019 #IGF19 #UN

The #internet is an open an free space for new ideas and new business models. We need functioning competition law and anti-trust-law. Platforms have to remain open to #competition in order to achieve equal opportunity for all actors #IGF2019 #InternetGovernmentForum

We have to cooperate in order to fight #cybercrime internationally, because no form of #criminality is faster in overcoming multiple state borders. This is why we would like to call on all states to ratify the #BudapestConvention of 2001. #InternetGovernanceForum #IGF2019 #UN

The right for #privacy also requires its implementation and enforcement. We demand the right to end-to-end encryption without #backdoors. The #RightToPrivacy  and their people's #data has to be protected from #states and #companies. #InternetGovernmentForum #IGF2019

People want access to the #internet withouth being blocked or censored! The basis for free access and participation is the #UNHumanRightsConvention that underlines the principle of freedom of expression. All actors have to adhere to that! #IGF2019 #InternetGovernanceForum
